A0F8F223A94547B7BA452BA63FDFDD2B.description: Reflect on the importance of prayer in developing a relationship with Jesus.

9E82B5E6E4794B10B782CE54A284C7AC.description: Pray the Lord's Prayer, the quintessential prayer of the Church (CCC 2776).

35DB65F7ED2A43B99D35E44D4A1C80D6.description: Review and pray the Liturgy of the Hours.

A39507C4FDE74F66BF15F03163B78261.description: Experience individual, communal, spontaneous, reflective, family, and liturgical prayers.

5A3D51CBFFE54B84BB555C5668FA8966.description: Experience different forms of Scriptural prayer.

EEC355CAEE08496B9A3AD8BDF0402AFB.description: Prayerfully read and utilize Lectio Divina throughout Scripture.

0BA9B0D6953A4161ADD37AD41BF2D734.description: Identify the types of prayer: vocal prayer, meditation, and contemplative prayer (CCC 2722-2724).

C91C26DC96144E0999D3DD9B621319C9.description: Practice different forms of traditional daily prayer (Hail Mary, The Angelus, Memorare, Glory Be, etc.).

8CC738CD3D6044FE9533502D20459925.description: Create various types of prayers using ritual actions and sacramentals.

000F93F703484BC0856D8377E577CA9E.description: Develop short prayer services using each of the five forms of prayer.

3039E44B10494892A19B7ED56D532C6E.description: Review and discuss the five forms of prayer: adoration and blessing, thanksgiving, praise, petition, intercession.

12650FAFCE1841FF88291B4C39D6686F.description: Investigate and connect the five forms of prayer.

05A0430C5614491883C5B93874359F81.description: Know and practice the four forms of prayer: blessing and adoration, petition, intercession, and thanksgiving (CCC 2625).

29DCE444DF22416D8401FC1CE1B3671B.description: Engage in and practice daily conversation with God.

B11231E2272D435C9B0121383F252702.description: Encounter the Holy Trinity in various forms of prayer.

8197B11C123140A9910D96F14E26C66A.description: Compare and contrast the prayer methods of the patriarchs found in Scripture.

698AD1E5B0CD4FDCA2C010D42D0B03E5.description: Practice Christian prayer, which is a covenant relationship between God and man in Christ (CCC 2564).

84FF9F58B06C40FF80DA869D5CB3B85A.description: Discuss what it means to be a steward of the Church.

341AA41487D3483DB2B9ABAA10D72852.description: Practice responsible stewardship and exercise leadership skills in responding to the needs of the community.

C00296AF95BB40E6955BD6284CA1B8CE.description: Respect the integrity of all creation, including animals, plants, and all nature (CCC 2415).

CAB6870523874B149172E30889DFE16A.description: Indicate how just and unjust policies and actions within the local and global communities, are, or are not, in compliance with the Catholic Social Justice Teachings.

D4EDDA9856DC4F2281640FA23009FEC9.description: Discuss the importance of recognizing and appreciating the diversity of cultures, traditions, talents, and gifts.

41E63F207E734E3782B3F7EA1002E9E5.description: Discuss the responsibility each has for living according to the Ten Commandments.

9794A04E1C734D37BFCC853F657AE978.description: Propose possible solutions to injustice and their results.

AD3D53BAEA7342B28FC09851CF03EAFB.description: Collaborate on and perform a local service project that demonstrates leadership skills.

E5E4E5FEB4B0416F9E3A968648A7C024.description: Identify the challenges and the rewards of being a steward of the Church.

1E9DB416A12B4CDEBB3B62E185007ACD.description: Reflect upon the commitment demanded of a steward of the Church.

629F900C7C5748B8AAACE1626EAAB2DA.description: List ways that Jesus ministered to others and express ways that they must do the same.

A0D6058E0DF0423B9EA8BCB84ECF76A6.description: Identify just and unjust policies and actions within the local and global communities.

F6704CEEDE6A4141A09E4ACFB2E50D92.description: Discuss the ministry of Jesus and our personal responsibility in his mission and ministry.

FF35805DC84B43008F0435A698DB3DB3.description: Demonstrate appreciation of God’s Word and show gratitude for God’s goodness and guidance.

6293710EBD0E4EEE8D2AA326E079E0E9.description: Show responsibility for choices made and their consequences.

0DDCF557DE734D6582EC0F74355E1549.description: Analyze the role of a steward of the Church.

BE6188430E4341C2ACBF41C61387C21C.description: Discuss the positive and negative influences exerted by popular culture including media, video games, and the Internet.

384E50DCB56B43E29B0E0DA74CEB080E.description: Explain the Precepts of the Church and what they mean for each person.

E45117537E7D4932A1E4FE3BDEC65F22.description: Foster peer support for responsible decision-making.

983B7DB3DF844C09A9713FBA5F56EBBC.description: Recognize that in the Sacrament of Reconciliation, Jesus gives us forgiveness, healing, comfort, and reunion.

8FF46BBE7B694A6F86AFBE28A47E9A83.description: Explain that God’s faithful love repeatedly offers us mercy and forgiveness.

193C8EC70F1A46BBAB983416A4FD54E6.description: Reflect on how sin hurts all of us and the need we have for reconciliation.

4D81AAC17FFF4AD1BE91DE4EB5A3891E.description: Know that sin is an offense against God (CCC 1850).

4DC55BDF47D348518F6BC5F54F241637.description: Reflect upon the Spiritual Works of Mercy and discuss ways in which one can live and act accordingly.

EF267809B74B40B48A368E676275A2F5.description: Reflect upon the Corporal Works of Mercy and discuss ways in which one can live and act accordingly.

2FF4DA1269044D738F3D8CA93D0C39CE.description: Explain how the Corporal and Spiritual Works of Mercy call us to share in the mission of Jesus.

9191B5D85B50457B898FDE6E4DF02370.description: Cultivate the theological virtues of faith, hope, and charity; and practice the cardinal virtues of prudence, justice, fortitude and temperance (CCC 1834; 1841).

3BDEF14A3F314537A40A13961B86FB03.description: Consider how the decisions we make affect the lives of those around us.

8FC8C011C57543B489CC890434074CF5.description: Develop a deeper understanding of the way we are called to live because of our covenant with God.

58442BE847E242C28BB320286108550C.description: Reflect upon the importance of making responsible decisions in our daily lives.

BD19394258174362AF9AACE62BE8BE7B.description: Know that we must assume responsibility for the acts we perform (CCC 1781).

88464E1EC0354B7C92090353D67D01D6.description: Analyze the call to the single life or married life as a vocation within the Church.

2471CDA11497446283E17AF7F46DCF39.description: Analyze the various religious vocations in the Church: priesthood, diaconate, religious brothers, religious sisters.

557208D7E5324D41AD4D5222C6A0BC50.description: Reflect on the call each of us receives from God to live a holy life.

2AC23C85F6B5434185BD93307B593DC9.description: Invite people of different vocations to discuss their roles in the Church and local communities.

38E1602200264C08A67414B5B377D501.description: Identify different vocations and describe ways they are serving God and the Church.

04DF731C9FD74B539D179087601B5FB2.description: Identify the components of a good moral choice.

6AAD867A997C474AB064DAF5899F3171.description: Understand that we shape our own life as a result of free will (CCC 1731).

987377F80F244B94A2EF03E17776D685.description: Identify sacred space, symbols, and art found within the church, school and classroom.

17AD03EF8B8D4046AB50E20253DD4CA5.description: Describe the use of sacred space, symbols, and art within the Church.

7F9DAE1B12D246E8A25B79377F046126.description: Comprehend that the musical tradition of the universal Church is a treasure of great value (CCC 1156).

243269783BEC41A19E55FC8F8DF72AF7.description: Identify and explain the meaning of ritual action and the use of sacramentals.

A962AF48F4F74A89B5A39558CFF6B233.description: Identify how the Church uses sacred signs, symbols, and ritual actions in its prayer.

84D88B2CC571450D9036C868BC59DEEA.description: Recognize that signs and symbols are part of sacramental celebration (CCC 1145).

70FC1AC191F94551ABA18B84BC290F8C.description: Identify the feast days the Church has to honor Mary and the saints.

9824D6DFCA30460D9EFCF3EED61E2A6B.description: Discuss the meanings of each season of the Church year and the significance of their rituals.

DB0352BC891C4E34ADC88554F5148A18.description: Review the Holy Days of Obligation and other important holy days within the Church calendar, and then discuss how they fit into the Liturgical Calendar.

1A7965AF3C314865BE7F4D0A07260666.description: Identify how to live in community and to participate actively in the life and mission of the Church.

D131C91F721042A9874605FD30F63E51.description: Identify how to pray with Christ.

2166E7EA72264A79A709347E4614E95B.description: Celebrate the sacraments to receive God's grace (CCC 1127).

979AD3B3F9B548CE8B262C0847607F56.description: The Celebration of the Christian Mystery

C6CA12C3E55A4F6E94C2B956807B00E2.description: Understand we place all our hope ‘in the prayer of Christ for the Church, in the love of the Father for us, and in the power of the Holy Spirit.

82827C8B2FE0410E97DE20B2B35C7B64.description: Recognize that reconciliation of all Christians in the unity of the one and only Church of Christ transcends human powers and gifts.

634FB55C50A24AF5A6C9BD01BEE611AB.description: Know that sin separates us from God (CCC 1033).

72C5B14E370B4EB9ABAF3FACAB69F20D.description: Analyze the action of the Holy Spirit: in Creation, in the giving of the law, and in the exodus and exile experiences.

88791C0CEBFD41CBA9731F1CB056A9F9.description: Believe that faith is possible only through the Holy Spirit (CCC 683).

4F7D21E230E140668880CBF78B22AFC4.description: Distinguish between the Spiritual and Corporal Works of Mercy.

2A11342D0872418CA10BE29F5471EF27.description: Compare and contrast the two creation stories found in Genesis and recognize that all people are created in God’s image and, therefore, have dignity.

FEBD73330A134089BC849BFFF4BAEF6B.description: Know that we are created in God’s image to serve Him and to rule over all creatures (CCC 380).

34A6FA99CA34420EBD3E06A6816D5D56.description: Recognize the Jewish faith is already a response to God’s revelation in the Old Covenant.

443877490F364A3A8AC6DE8DAFCAC904.description: Connect how Jewish traditions are part of our historical, cultural, and religious heritage.

23C365E7D18E4368AE6967C491FDAB81.description: Understand that faith is a gift from God (CCC 552).

A0E0837DE96243DA9E7DA504DB8A2137.description: Discuss the meaning of Pentateuch or Torah.

D10A3546409943F6B45C556847B7522B.description: Recognize that the meaning of Old Testament Scripture should follow the rules of sound interpretation

E56700426B974040933843E4E2071AC4.description: Differentiate among the different writing forms in the Old Testament: prayer, law, parable, history, psalms, letters, prophecy, poems, wise saying or speech.

888993BF844444318AE32FF16B0A9C36.description: Categorize the arrangement of the books of the Bible, especially the Old Testament, according to their four categories: Torah (Law), History, Wisdom, and Prophets.

6E86B5205EE9453089FE7C3F15F5B769.description: Interpret what is meant by divine inspiration.

0F40F233C8844E70946F159410459CC5.description: Analyze the Bible as Sacred Scripture.

1930B2CF06A24F089670254180097C3A.description: Know that God is the author of Sacred Scripture (CCC 105).

16D33F7C17204FC4997B90E02A7F56CC.description: Compare how Jesus is seen as the New Exodus, the New Commandment, the New Covenant.

EDA7B3501116488AA70305CF41022D0C.description: Explore how Jesus is the fulfillment of the Old Testament through related passages in the New Testament.

E3BDF57E1D134CFD8898144150D50008.description: Identify Old Testament prophets and connect their messages to Jesus in the New Testament.

8177B09F949E4D07834AC374C9F0E98A.description: Cite evidence that the Old Testament books reveal Christ’s significance, lead us to act justly, and lead us to heaven.

99AA511C010D4353B1C5BC7CFBDA587B.description: Understand that God revealed himself to us through Christ, His Son (CCC 65).

09C729EC18FE4F448E775D1D8AAE799C.description: Recognize that the covenant at Sinai created a loving relationship between God and his people and set them apart as his chosen people.

01E83F557A8E457F8FAE02C1B1B9794C.description: Compare how the covenant of baptism (with God and the community) relates to the Old and New Covenants.

8B1807803B3A41B4B2885CE35A48B221.description: Connect the meaning of covenant in salvation history.

2B450F62108D4B91BC2DB15B3AFFE883.description: Know that the one true God, our Creator and Lord, can be known with certainty from His works, by the natural light of human reason (CCC 47).

EA13DF94584F4F6F8BA3BE3D392CD725.description: Predict ways to be good stewards of the earth.

0F439E6209CC41AF86D954F43507D246.description: Draw conclusions about what it means to be stewards of all of God's creation.

1376FD98D1EB40D6B7DCB46ED8D74B9E.description: Recognize God in the world’s order, beauty, and goodness (CCC 32).

31FC151FC4F842A695B47CBB1C1D8981.description: Option for the Poor and Vulnerable
